marketNews.title: Powell Signals Slower Rate Cut Pace
marketNews.content:
Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Thursday (14 November) that the Fed does not need to rush to cut interest rates given the current economy which is 'very good'. Powell's statement came one day after the release of US October 2024 inflation data, which rose to 2.6% year‑on‑year (versus September 2024: 2.4% YoY), ending a six‑month downward trend. Powell emphasized that the Fed still considers inflation to be on a sustainable path toward the 2% target, allowing the central bank to move policy rates to a more neutral level that neither stimulates nor restrains economic growth. The exact neutral rate and the speed at which the Fed will reach it remain unknown. Meanwhile, US economic growth and inflation outlook face uncertainty from protectionist policies expected from President‑elect Donald Trump.

Following Powell’s less dovish remarks, analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool shows that the probability of a 25‑basis‑point Fed rate cut at the December 2024 meeting fell sharply, from 82.5% on 13 November to 58.9% on Friday (15 November). Likewise, the probability of a cut of 75 basis points or more by June 2025 dropped from 47% to 34% over the past week, while the probability of a cut of less than 75 basis points by June 2025 rose from 53% to 66%.

On Thursday (14 November) US equity markets fell together, with the S&P 500 down 0.60%, Nasdaq down 0.64%, and Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.47%. The US dollar index (DXY) rose 0.09% on Thursday, although it weakened 0.1% to 106.56 by Friday afternoon (15 November).

The Indonesian composite index (IHSG) closed down 0.74% today, while the 10‑year Indonesian government bond yield fell 4 basis points to 6.92%. The rupiah weakened intraday by 0.6% before closing flat at 15,855 per US dollar, mainly supported by Bank Indonesia intervention. Bank Indonesia’s Head of Monetary Management and Securities Assets, Edi Susianto, told Bloomberg that the fundamental level of the rupiah is stronger than 16,000 per US dollar.

Key Takeaway: A slower or smaller Fed rate‑cut trajectory in 2025 could reduce the space for Bank Indonesia to lower the BI Rate. Bloomberg consensus projects that Bank Indonesia will cut rates by a total of 100 basis points by the end of 2025. From a market perspective, although foreign outflows from the IHSG continue after Trump’s victory, the outflow value has shrunk to about IDR 517 billion, indicating that most selling pressure may already be priced in.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Trade Surplus Declines in October 2024
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s trade surplus narrowed to USD 2.47 billion in October 2024 (versus USD 3.47 billion in October 2023 and USD 3.23 billion in September 2024), below the consensus expectation of a USD 3.05 billion surplus. The result marks the continuation of a surplus streak for 54 consecutive months, but it is the smallest since June 2024. The decline was driven by a 17.49% year‑on‑year increase in imports, which outpaced export growth of 10.25% year‑on‑year. For the first ten months of 2024, the trade surplus reached USD 34.04 billion (versus USD 31.22 billion in the same period of 2023), with exports and imports growing 1.33% and 5.25% year‑on‑year respectively.

marketNews.title: Garuda Indonesia Appoints New President Director
marketNews.content: Shareholders of Garuda Indonesia (ticker GIAA) approved the appointment of Wamildan Tsani Panjaitan as the company’s new President Director on Friday (15 November), replacing Irfan Setiaputra. Previously, Wamildan had served as acting President Director at PT Lion Air since 2023.

marketNews.title: Jakarta Gubernatorial Candidates Promise to Close Delta Djakarta Alcoholic Beverage Plant
marketNews.content: Jakarta’s gubernatorial and deputy‑governor candidates, Ridwan Kamil and Suswono, said they will close the Delta Djakarta alcoholic beverage plant (ticker DLTA) if elected. The promise is part of a 16‑point integrity pact between the ticket and local religious leaders. In addition to shutting the plant, the pact includes the full divestment of the Jakarta provincial government’s shareholding in DLTA.

marketNews.title: EU Parliament Demands Further Changes to Deforestation Rules
marketNews.content: The European Parliament on Thursday (14 November) demanded further changes to the substance of the anti‑deforestation law. The move follows a request for amendment from its largest political group, the European People’s Party, to soften the regulation. The demand adds to previous discussions about postponing implementation for 12 months until the end of 2025. Bloomberg reported that if the amendment is not finalized by the deadline, the anti‑deforestation regulation could be applied from 30 December 2024 without any changes.

marketNews.title: China Retail Sales Rise 4.8% YoY in October 2024
marketNews.content: China’s National Bureau of Statistics reported that retail sales in China increased 4.8% year‑on‑year in October 2024 (versus September 2024: 3.2% YoY), surpassing the consensus forecast of 3.8% YoY. The result marks the strongest growth since February 2024, driven by a week‑long holiday, shopping festivals, and a series of stimulus measures introduced by the Chinese government at the end of September 2024 to boost demand.

marketNews.title: China New Home Prices Drop 5.9% YoY in October 2024
marketNews.content: The same bureau reported that new home prices in 70 Chinese cities fell 5.9% year‑on‑year in October 2024 (versus September 2024: -5.8% YoY). This represents a 16‑month consecutive decline and the deepest contraction since April 2015, even as the Chinese government continues to mitigate the slowdown in the property sector through lower mortgage rates and reduced home‑purchase costs. Investment in the real‑estate sector also fell 10.3% year‑on‑year, the deepest decline since August 2021.

marketNews.title: China Real Estate Investment Declines 10.3% YoY
marketNews.content: Investment in the real estate sector in China fell 10.3% year‑on‑year in October 2024 (versus September 2024: -10.1% YoY), marking the deepest drop since August 2021.

marketNews.title: China Industrial Production Grows 5.3% YoY in October 2024
marketNews.content: The National Bureau of Statistics reported that industrial production in China grew 5.3% year‑on‑year in October 2024 (versus September 2024: 5.4% YoY), below the consensus expectation of 5.6% YoY. On a month‑to‑month basis, industrial production rose 0.41% in October 2024 (versus September 2024: 0.59% MoM). Cumulatively for the first ten months of 2024, industrial production increased 5.8% year‑on‑year (versus 4.1% in the same period of 2023).

marketNews.title: Indonesia Plans LPG Plant Investment for 2025
marketNews.content: Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the government will start preparing an investment plan for a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) plant in January 2025. He explained that the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources and SKK Migas are currently finalising the plant concept, which is expected to have a production capacity of around 1.5‑2 million tonnes per year. The LPG plant project aims to reduce import dependence, as total LPG consumption in Indonesia reaches 8 million tonnes per year while domestic production is only 1.9 million tonnes per year.

tickerNews.title: Smartfren Telecom Secures Syndicated Loan up to Rp10 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Smartfren Telecom and its subsidiary PT Smart Telecom (Smartel) signed a syndicated loan agreement of up to IDR 10 trillion with six banks, with Bank Central Asia (BBCA) and PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur acting as mandated lead arranger and bookrunner. The funds will be used for refinancing existing loans of the company and Smartel, financing a spectrum frequency band auction, and capital expenditures of the company and/or Smartel. The loan facility has a term of seven years with an interest rate of JIBOR 3‑month plus a certain margin. Smartfren explained that the syndicated loan carries a more competitive interest rate compared with existing facilities, and both the company and Smartel will receive additional capital for network development and service improvement.

tickerNews.title: Antam Plans $6 Billion Battery Ecosystem Syndicated Loan
tickerNews.content: Antam Director I Dewa Wirantaya said the company has appointed a lead arranger from China to arrange a syndicated loan for an electric‑vehicle battery ecosystem project valued at USD 6 billion. The project will be executed by a consortium consisting of Antam, Battery Corporation (IBC), and CATL’s subsidiary CBL International Development Pte. Ltd. Dewa stated that 60% of the project financing will come from loans, with the remainder provided by equity contributions from each consortium member. The syndicated loan is expected to be realised by the end of 2024, allowing the first construction phase to start in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Toba Energi Targets 46 MWp Floating Solar Plant in Batam by 2025
tickerNews.content: Toba Energi Utama’s Investor Relations, Nafi Achmad Sentausa, said the company targets a 46 MWp floating solar power plant (PLTS) in Tembesi, Batam, to become commercially operational in 2025. The floating solar plant has signed a power purchase agreement with PLN Batam for 25 years. Nafi also mentioned that Toba is exploring new investment plans to develop its renewable energy portfolio and post‑divestment waste management after divesting two coal‑fired power plants, PT Minahasa Cahaya Lestari and PT Gorontalo Listrik, valued at USD 144.8 million. The divestment was approved in the extraordinary shareholders meeting on Thursday (14 November).

tickerNews.title: Multi Bintang Indonesia Announces Interim Dividend of Rp400.3 Billion
tickerNews.content: Multi Bintang Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 400.3 billion or IDR 190 per share. The cum‑date in the regular market is 22 November 2024, with payment on 12 December 2024. Based on the closing price of MLBI on Friday (15 November) at IDR 6,400 per share, the implied dividend yield is 3%.

tickerNews.title: Indosat Director Purchases 921,900 Shares
tickerNews.content: Indosat Director General Vikram Sinha purchased 921,900 ISAT shares at an average price of IDR 2,166 per share on 11 November 2024. The total transaction value is approximately IDR 2 billion. After the transaction, Vikram’s ownership in ISAT increased from 0.0064% to 0.0092%.

tickerNews.title: Sarinah Mitra Luas Director Buys 87.4 Million SMIL Shares
tickerNews.content: Sarina Mitra Luas Chairman and President Director Hadi Suhermin bought 87.4 million SMIL shares at IDR 172 per share on 12 November 2024. The total transaction value is about IDR 15 billion. After the transaction, Hadi’s ownership in SMIL rose from 48% to 49%.

tickerNews.title: Humpuss Maritim Acquires Oil Tanker for Rp65.5 Billion
tickerNews.content: Humpuss Maritim Internasional, through its subsidiary PT Hutama Trans Kontinental, acquired one oil‑tanker unit worth IDR 65.5 billion from a non‑affiliated party, PT Maritim Indo Trans. The transaction was financed using bank loans and internal cash.
